text: Yes it does. Ok new challenge, new brief that might hope you think about composition in the framing. All of this can directly apply to drawing, graphic design and especially animation, or any moving image (cinematography, photography, vfx, games too).

Brief: 
Shoot some photographs that create drama around the edges of the frame.

An example from a famous photographer:
<https://goo.gl/images/xxuoGJ>

<https://www.magnumphotos.com/newsroom/conflict/telex-iran-in-the-name-of-revolution/>

Gilles Peress artist. 

Often people put the main content of a image/photo in the centre of the frame. That ok, but now try this different approach. More about the edges  of the frame.

attachments.title: Telex Iran: In the Name of Revolution • Gilles Peress • Magnum Photos
attachments.text: Gilles Peress's seminal publication 'Telex Iran' documents life under the Iranian regime during the late 1970s including the American Embassy hostage crisis
attachments.fallback: Magnum Photos: Telex Iran: In the Name of Revolution • Gilles Peress • Magnum Photos

text:
Peress is a political photographer so has heavy content, but an amazing artist too with the camera. 
Let me know if you have any questions as you start to shoot :blush:
